identificationModule.briefTitle: Novel Treatment For Pusher Syndrome Using Physical Therapy

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Assistant Professor, Residency Program Director, PM&R

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to see if a specific physical therapy intervention speeds recovery from stroke-related "pusher syndrome."

primaryOutcomes.measure: Recovery from pusher syndrome as measured by changes in the Burke Lateropulsion Scale score over time.
primaryOutcomes.description: The Burke Lateropulsion Scale (BLS) is used in the literature to measure the presence of pusher syndrome. We will measure BLS upon admission and at weekly intervals to monitor whether patients in the experimental group demonstrate faster recovery than the control group, as demonstrated by change in BLS score over change in time (days).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Initial, and then weekly until discharge from inpatient rehabilitation unit. Average inpatient stay is expected to be no greater than 4 weeks.
